## Description {#details}

Graph of irreducible control flow.

This graph is used for determining the SCCs in a loop (or top-level function) that has irreducible control flow.

During the block frequency algorithm, the local graphs are defined in a light-weight way, deferring to the <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a></em> or <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a></em> graphs for most edges, but getting others from <em>LoopData::ExitMap</em>. The latter only has successor information.

<em><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/bfi-detail/irreduciblegraph">IrreducibleGraph</a></em> makes this graph explicit. It&#39;s in a form that can use <em><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/graphtraits">GraphTraits</a></em> (so that <em>analyzeIrreducible()</em> can use <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scc-iterator">scc&#95;iterator</a></em>), and it explicitly lists predecessors and successors. The initialization that relies on <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a></code> is defined in the header.

Definition at line 599 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/blockfrequencyinfoimpl-h">BlockFrequencyInfoImpl.h</a>.

## Public Constructors

### IrreducibleGraph() {#a1147f0ef1ac705077e24462022b4ae1e}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;class BlockEdgesAdder&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>llvm::bfi&#95;detail::IrreducibleGraph::IrreducibleGraph (<a href="#a281c4629c5f31af3afd60c42fbd93f6b">BFIBase</a> &amp; BFI, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/blockfrequencyinfoimplbase/loopdata">BFIBase::LoopData</a> &#42; OuterLoop, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/bfi-detail/blockedgesadder">BlockEdgesAdder</a> addBlockEdges)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Construct an explicit graph containing irreducible control flow.

Construct an explicit graph of the control flow in <code>OuterLoop</code> (or the top-level function, if <code>OuterLoop</code> is <code>nullptr</code>). Uses <code>addBlockEdges</code> to add block successors that have not been packaged into loops.

<em>BlockFrequencyInfoImpl::computeIrreducibleMass()</em> is the only expected user of this.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/blockfrequencyinfoimpl-h/#l00634">634</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/blockfrequencyinfoimpl-h">BlockFrequencyInfoImpl.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
